item.title: Service Intermittent Interruption When Accessing SendGrid.com and SendGrid Blog posts
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Potential Issue with SendGrid.com and SendGrid Blog Posts

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with access to SendGrid.com and SendGrid Blog Posts, causing errors for users. This does not impact mail send. Further updates will be provided.

Feb 22, 13:19 PST
Investigating - Starting around 12:06 PM Pacific Time on Thursday, February 22nd, Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with access to SendGrid.com and SendGrid Blog Posts. Users may experience issues with accessing the websites and receive errors. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

item.title: SendGrid Mail Sending Delays
item.content:encoded:
Feb 6, 18:08 PST
Resolved - After monitoring, our engineers confirmed that changes deployed to correct the identified hardware problem solved the issue and new mail traffic requested to the SendGrid system will not be delayed. This incident has been resolved.

Feb 6, 17:34 PST
Update - The system is continuing to be monitored at this time as it relates to this incident. Another update will be provided in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Feb 6, 16:33 PST
Monitoring - Our engineers confirmed that delayed emails due to this hardware problem have been successfully dequeued from the system. New mail traffic requested to the SendGrid system will not be delayed due to this problem as changes were deployed to correct the identified hardware problem. The system will continue to be monitored and another update will be provided in the next hour or as soon as possible.

Feb 6, 16:08 PST
Identified - Starting at 3:00 PM PT on February 6, 2024, our engineers confirmed an issue with the hardware related to mail send for the SendGrid platform. Due to this hardware issue, users of the platform may have experienced delays in mail send requests to the system. Our engineering team deployed a change to help mitigate affected delayed traffic at 3:42 PM PT. While this does affect mail send, only a subset of customers sending mail were affected. We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

item.title: SendGrid Accounts Erroneously Suspended
item.content:encoded:
Dec 11, 09:27 PST
Resolved - Beginning at 6:20 AM PST on December 11th, 2023, several customer accounts were incorrectly suspended, impacting mail send. At 9:00 AM PST, these accounts were unsuspended, reactivating mail send. If your account was affected, the admin email address on file for your account will have been sent a notice of suspension and reactivation. Suspensions on these accounts did queue outbound email requests, but no mail was lost during the period. At this time, all systems are confirmed to be operational.

item.title: Intermittent Error When Clicking Unsubscribe Links
item.content:encoded:
Oct 27, 14:08 PDT
Resolved - Our engineering team determined that unsubscribes began to intermittently fail when clicking on unsubscribe links beginning at approximately 5:10 AM PDT on October 24th, 2023. After investigating this issue further, the resulting error when links failed would include "invalid unsubscribe request" on an otherwise properly formatted unsubscribe link. Due to the nature of the issue, not all unsubscribe links during the affected period failed but instead the occurring issue intermittently affected links. On October 26th at approximately 9:30 AM PDT, the engineering team deployed code to resolve the intermittently failing unsubscribe links. Valid unsubscribe links previously failing have since been reported as resolving properly. This issue did not affect mail send. Systems are now operating normally at this time. Thank you for your patience while this issue was being resolved.

item.title: Email Validations API Inaccessible Due to Unauthorized Errors
item.content:encoded:
Oct 17, 11:55 PDT
Resolved - Starting at 9:55 AM PT on October 17, 2023, our engineers confirmed that API calls made to the Email Validations API endpoint began to fail with unauthorized errors. However, at 11:19 AM PT, functionality was restored to the API and services began to operate normally again. Any SendGrid users attempting to access the Email Validations API during the affected period will have experienced "403" error code responses or failure messages relating to an invalid security token. This incident did not affect mail send directly. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are now operating normally.

item.title: Customers Creating Subusers that Require Provisioning
item.content:encoded:
Oct 10, 05:00 PDT
Resolved - From around 6:52am PT 10/10/2023 to about 9:56am PT 10/10/2023, we experienced an isolated issue with the creation of subusers for a certain subset of customers.

Affected customers who tried to create a subuser account during the affected period would have seen those new accounts created in a "provision needed" status and those subuser accounts would not be functional upon creation. Affected new subusers that need provisioning will be fixed by our engineers, and should be functional shortly.

The issue has been mitigated and resolved, and all services are now operating normally.
